alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Southern Johnson County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 3:40AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Logan, southwestern Newton and Johnson Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 340 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fern to near Branch to near Fort Chaffee. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Booneville... Paris... Lamar... Magazine... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Scranton... Ratcliff... Blue Mountain... Devils Knob... Hoyt... Midway in Logan County... Holman... Rosetta... Dillen... Woodland... Hinkle... Mount Magazine... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 45 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
